result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R Wild

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:07 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to Count 1 on 2016CM12, Count 2 on 2016CM13 and Counts 1 & 2 on 2016CM53 with all other counts being dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CM12, on count 2 on 2016CM13 and on counts 1 & 2 on 2016CM53.  Court orders Count 3 on 2016CM53, Count 1 on 2016CM13 and 2016CM65 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM12

90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-No Contact with the victim.
-Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up.
-Court costs.
-DNA sample.

2016CM13

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-DNA sample
-Restitution $600

2016CM53 (Count 1 & 2)

Count 2-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-DNA Sample

Count 1

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS

-30 days county jail, with credit for time served.
-Court costs
-DNA Sample

Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.
State's
Defendant's
Defendant's
By Atty Barb Privat
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Original Warrant received and destroyed
Status hearing on April 12, 2016 at 10:45 am.

9:33 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has not been able to contact the PD's office.  Statement by the Court - will advise the Public Defender to meet with him.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 12, 2016 at 10:45 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:35 a.m.

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Rhonda at GLSO.
43
Status hearing on April 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

1:09 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  2016CM65 - Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant requests to talk with the DA.  Court goes ove right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court quashes the warrants.  Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Court sets all cases for Status Hearing on April 4, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Courtesy copy of warrant has been returned.  Return to sender.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to Forward.
Notice of hearing for Initial Appearance scheduled on March 14, 2016 at 9:30 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to Forward.

Warrant has been sent down to GLSO on 03/14/2016.
43

Defendant called to inform us that he was not able to make court today as he did not have a ride.  Informed the defendant that he missed the last court date and it was rescheduled because he called, and the court authorized a warrant.  Informed him he either needed to find a ride as the notice was sent out on 03/08 and is he did not appear, the warrant would be issued.
43
Initial appearance on March 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant called in regards to the court date he missed.  Address on file is correct.  Defendant to appear in court on March 14, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.
43

9:48 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - forthwith on all cases.  Statement by ADA Vanden Branden - defendant did not appear for the pretrial conference.

Court adjourned at 9:48 a.m.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
